meanings.definition: To rouse to action or effort; stir up; arouse.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside finally bestirs the sleeping dog.
meanings.sent2: She bestirs herself early in the morning to start her day.
meanings.sent3: The smell of bacon bestirs him from his deep slumber.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speech bestirs the team to work harder.
meanings.sent5: The urgent message bestirs everyone into immediate action.

meanings.definition: To put into motion or activity; rouse.
meanings.sent1: The gentle breeze bestirs the leaves on the trees.
meanings.sent2: He bestirs the crowd with his powerful speech.
meanings.sent3: The smell of fresh cookies bestirs her to bake in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The new project bestirs excitement among the team members.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock bestirs him from his peaceful slumber.
